p: Traditional medicine has been applied in combating antimicrobial resistance [ 36]. For instance, the stem bark of R. vulgaris is traditionally used in the treatment of toothaches [ 8] supporting its activity against S. mutans. Furthermore, extracts of R. vulgaris were bactericidal against MRSA and S. aureus. MeOH:DCM extracts of R. vulgaris were bactericidal while methanol extracts were bacteriostatic against S. mutans. The MIC and MBC values of R. vulgaris methanol extracts were ≤ 3.13 mg/ml against S. aureus and MRSA.
